title: ASCII escape codes don't render with `include_str!`
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

ASCII escape codes aren't rendered correctly when using `include_str!()`.

I've tested this on both stable and nightly channels and they produce identical output. I've also tested a couple terminal emulators (Alacritty and xfce4-terminal) and again they produce identical outputs.

Code:

```rust
fn main() {
    print!(include_str!("input.txt"));
    print!("{}", include_str!("input.txt"));
    print!("\x1b[1mTEST\x1b[0m\n");
}
```

Contents of `input.txt`:

```
\x1b[1mTEST\x1b[0m

```

Output:
```
\x1b[1mTEST\x1b[0m
\x1b[1mTEST\x1b[0m
TEST
```

(The lone *TEST* correctly appears in bold).

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

Stable:
```
rustc 1.64.0 (a55dd71d5 2022-09-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52
commit-date: 2022-09-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.64.0
LLVM version: 14.0.6
```

Nightly:
```
rustc 1.66.0-nightly (7fcf850d7 2022-10-23)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7fcf850d7942804990a1d2e3fe036622a0fe4c74
commit-date: 2022-10-23
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.66.0-nightly
LLVM version: 15.0.2
```
